thread.title: Top 10 facts about Tuesday's Democratic presidential debate
thread.title_full: Top 10 facts about Tuesday's Democratic presidential debate - POLITICO

author: Jack Shafer
title: Top 10 facts about Tuesday's Democratic presidential debate
text:
When is the first Democratic presidential debate?
The Democratic presidential debate will be Tuesday, Oct. 13, live from the Wynn Las Vegas, a hotel and casino on the Las Vegas Strip. The debate will begin at 9 p.m. Eastern Time. How long is the debate?
While CNN's programming kicks off at 8:30 p.m., the debate itself runs two hours, from 9p.m. to 11 p.m.
How can I watch the debate?
The debate will air on CNN, CNN International and CNN en Español. It also will livestream on CNN.com.
Who will participate in the debate?
Five Democratic candidates are expected to participate: Lincoln Chafee, Hillary Clinton, Martin O'Malley, Bernie Sanders and Jim Webb will be onstage.
How did CNN decide who would be in the debate?
CNN's criteria requires each candidates who participates to have achieved an average of at least 1 percent in three qualifying polls released from Aug. 1 to Oct. 10.
What about Vice President Joe Biden?
If the vice president jumps in the race before the debate — which is unlikely — CNN has invited him to participate.
What order will they appear on the stage?
Hillary Clinton, the highest polling candidate, will stand center-stage for the debate. To Clinton's right is Sanders, followed by Webb. To Clinton's left is O'Malley, then Chafee. If Biden decides to jump in, a sixth podium will be added.
Who will moderate the debate?
CNN’s Anderson Cooper will moderate. CNN’s Dana Bash and CNN en Español's Juan Carlos López will also ask questions. CNN’s Don Lemon will add questions submitted via Facebook.
When is the next Democratic debate?
The next Democratic debate is set for Saturday, Nov. 14 — hosted by CBS News, KCCI-TV and the Des Moines Register — at Drake University in Des Moines, Iowa. It will be the only Democratic debate held in Iowa before the Feb. 1 caucuses.
When is the next GOP debate?
The next Republican debate is set for Wednesday, Oct. 28, hosted by CNBC at the University of Colorado-Boulder.
